definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Judge Stephens allowed no foolishness when he held court.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂芬斯法官开庭时不允许人胡来。

sentences.english: The next date in the case at New York Supreme Court before Judge Michael Obus was set for July 18.
sentences.chinese: 纽约最高法庭就此案的下次开庭日期是7月18日。

sentences.english: 1431 - The trial of Joan of Arc begins.
sentences.chinese: 1431年的今天，对“圣女贞德”的审判开庭。

sentences.english: Michael Jackson images dominate opening of death trial.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊死亡案再开庭，其生前照片令人揪心不已。

sentences.english: The appeals court has agreed to hear that case next week.
sentences.chinese: 上诉庭同意下周开庭审理那件案子。

sentences.english: The court case is scheduled for 29 January in Madras.
sentences.chinese: 这起案件将于1月29日在印度马德拉斯开庭审理。

sentences.english: No one knows the date of the wakening of the process.
sentences.chinese: 没人知道哪天重新开庭。

sentences.english: Only a little bright heart. Will you come hold court?
sentences.chinese: 只是一点点，智慧的小心肝儿。你会去开庭吧？

sentences.english: A prosecutor assigned to the courtroom handled most of the routine appearances and arraignments that were paraded through each day.
sentences.chinese: 一个公诉人一天会被分配到很多例行的开庭和传讯。

sentences.english: THE tribunal to try former Khmers Rouges began its real proceedings this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周，前红色高棉政权之审开庭。

sentences.english: This case is in yesterday afternoon court of more beautiful district is sessional .
sentences.chinese: 此案昨日下午在越秀区法院开庭。

sentences.english: The court met again after an adjournment of two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 法庭休庭两周后继续开庭。

sentences.english: The case against Mr. White is said to be heard tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 据说怀特先生被起诉一案定于明天开庭。

sentences.english: Article 45 The evidence shall be presented during the hearings and may be examined by the parties.
sentences.chinese: 第45条证据应当在开庭时出示，当事人可以质证。

sentences.english: Impeachment Trials The Senate shall have the sole power to try all impeachments .
sentences.chinese: 在开庭审理弹劾案时，参议员们均应宣誓或誓愿。

sentences.english: When does zhouzhenglong's case come on for trial?
sentences.chinese: 周正龙的案子什么时候开庭审理？

definition: to pronounce a sentence (after a verdict in a court of law)
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
public opinion/public announcement of verdict at a trial
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
